File/Folder List

This section explains the files and folders related to Kirikiri.
It does not cover all files. It focuses on files that require special attention. Please refer to readme.txt for the folder structure of the Kirikiri Z SDK distribution archive.
For convenience, files related to KAG are also listed.

Folders

plugin and plugin64
This is the folder where Kirikiri looks for plugins. If this folder exists in the same directory as the Kirikiri executable, Kirikiri will reference the plugins placed inside it. -> About Plugins
data and content-data
If this folder exists in the same directory as the Kirikiri executable, it will be treated as the project folder and executed. -> How to Start

Files

*.xp3
Archive file for Kirikiri. -> Releaser
data.xp3 and data.exe
If this file is in the same folder as the Kirikiri executable, Kirikiri treats it as the project folder and executes it. -> How to Start
*.tpm
A plugin for Kirikiri that is automatically loaded at startup. -> About Plugins
krdevui.dll
A DLL used in common by Kirikiri development tools. You do not need to include this file in distributions for end users.
krmovie.dll
Required when playing WMV/MPG in Kirikiri. If you do not perform video playback, you do not need to include this in distributions for end users. -> VideoOverlay Class
*.dll
In the case of plugins for Kirikiri, they must be included in distributions for end users. Of course, you do not need to include plugins that are not required. -> About Plugins
krkr.eXe
The Kirikiri core executable. You may change the filename when distributing to end users.
*.cf and *.cfu
Files containing options for the Kirikiri core. To enable options specified via "Kirikiri Configuration" (-userconf) (which includes the -datapath option specification, etc.), these must also be included in distributions for end users. -> Kirikiri Configuration
File Corruption Check Tool.exe and its .ini file
File corruption check tool. You may change the filename when distributing to end users, but in that case, both the .exe and .ini files must have the same name. In the Kirikiri Z SDK distribution, it is located in enduser-tools, but when distributing to end users, it usually needs to be placed in the same folder as the Kirikiri executable. -> File Corruption Check Tool
startup.tjs
TJS script file. Kirikiri looks for this file directly under the project folder and executes it first. -> How to Start
*.tjs
TJS script file.
msgmap.tjs
Message map file. If you do not recall creating one, you do not need to include this file in distributions for end users. ->
*.sig
Signature file output by the Key/Signature Tool. Referenced by the File Corruption Check Tool, etc. -> Key/Signature Tool
*.rpf
Releaser profile. Contains Releaser configuration information. This file does not need to be included in distributions for end users (Releaser excludes this file automatically). -> Releaser
hwexcept.log
May be created at the location specified by the -datapath option when the Kirikiri core crashes. While crashes occur in various situations, if this file is created, it indicates a severe crash; please collect it from the end user and send it to the Kirikiri author if necessary. This file does not need to be included in distributions for end users.
*.console.log
Kirikiri console log file. Usually, it may be created at the location specified by the -datapath option when Kirikiri crashes, etc. The logs recorded in this file are mostly due to script coding errors. Use it to help with debugging during application development or by collecting it from end users after distribution. This file does not need to be included in distributions for end users.
*.dump.txt
TJS dump file. This file does not need to be included in distributions for end users. ->
*.sli
Loop definition file output by the Loop Tuner. -> Loop Tuner
*.tft
Rendered font data output by the Rendered Font Data Creation Tool. -> Rendered Font
